recipes.name: Caramelized Onion Spaghetti
recipes.description: Creamy pasta with beautifully caramelized onions and herbs
recipes.ingredients:
Butter (generous amount)
2 medium onions, thinly sliced
Salt
4-5 garlic cloves, minced
Mixed herbs
Black pepper
Fresh cream
Spaghetti
Cheese
Fresh parsley
recipes.instructions:
Take butter, lots of it. Put thinly sliced onions, put thoda salt, add water, put lid till water evaporates thoda. 
Open lid, caramelize the onions, add water if they stick. This will take some time... when nearly caramelized, add some garlic. Add herbs, black pepper, salt, fresh cream. Then add the spaghetti to this pan, and add pasta water if required. Add cheese and parsley in the pan itself and then simmer a little bit. Taste it and done!

recipes.name: Garlic Bread
recipes.description: Crispy homemade garlic bread with herbs and butter
recipes.ingredients:
Butter (softened, room temperature)
6-7 garlic cloves
Fresh coriander, finely chopped
Salt (pinch)
Oregano
Chilli flakes
Bread slices
Cheese (optional)
recipes.instructions:
First take your butter. If it is straight out of the freezer, put it in the microwave for aese 10-15 seconds, not completely melting it, just some parts. Basically, you have to soften it, but not melt it. Room temperature butter works better. Mix it with a spoon.
Then you take 6-7 cloves of garlic and grate them... or you can also crush them with the "mortar and pestle" till you get a spreadable paste-like consistency. 
Then finely chop the coriander. Add the garlic and coriander in the butter. Then add a litttlleeee salt (zyada mat daalna hehe), oregano, chilli flakes. Mix mix mix! 
Once it is ready, take your bread slices, spread the butter mix on one side jaise jam lagate hain. If you want to use a sandwich maker, take aese 2 bread slices, spread the garlic butter on them, put them together (you can add cheese between them too). Then put them in the sandwich maker. When you take them out, you can have the slices separately too. If you want to make individuals, you can use a pan too. Done!

recipes.name: Vegetable Momos
recipes.description: Steamed dumplings with cabbage and vegetable filling
recipes.ingredients:
Cabbage, grated (excess water removed)
1 medium onion, finely chopped
4-5 garlic cloves, chopped
1 green chilli, chopped
1-2 inches ginger, grated
Oil
Vinegar (1/2 tsp)
Black pepper
Salt
Soy sauce
Maida (all-purpose flour)
Oil and salt for dough
recipes.instructions:
Grate cabbage, and make sure you remove the excess water. Cut one medium sized pyaaz into small pieces. Chop 4-5 cloves of garlic and 1 mirchi. Grate some adrak - about 1-2 inches. In a pan, take some oil, put the garlic and mirchi in it, and right afterwards put the ginger and onions, saute for a bit, should remain crunchy, add about half spoon vinegar. Add the grated cabbage, mix it together, add some black pepper. Turn off the gas, don't overcook. Let it cool down. After it has cooled, add salt and soy sauce, keep tasting as you go, and done with the filling.

For the dough, take maida, make a hole in the middle, put some oil and salt, mix it well with the flour. Keep adding water and kneeding it slowly. Make the momos. Let them steam for 15 mins on medium flame. Make the chutney. And doneee!

recipes.name: Samosas with Potato Filling
recipes.description: Crispy fried pastries with spiced potato filling
recipes.ingredients:
For Pudina Paste:
Handful of mint leaves
2 inch ginger
Handful of coriander
Little fennel seeds
2 green chillies
Water

For Masala Mix:
1 tsp kasuri methi
1/2 tsp black salt
1 tsp amchoor powder
1 tsp salt
1/2 tsp red chilli powder
1/2 tsp coriander powder
1 tsp roasted cumin powder
1/2 tsp black pepper
Pinch of garam masala

For Filling:
6 potatoes
2 tbsp oil

For Dough:
2.5 cups maida
3 tbsp oil
Salt
Water as needed
recipes.instructions:
For pudina paste: In a mixer jar, take a handful of pudina, 2 inch adrak, handful of dhaniya, thoodi si saunf?, 2 green mirch, thoda paani and make a paste, not very smooth.

Heat a pan, put 2 tbsp oil, add masala mix. Bhuno on low flame for 2-3 mins. Now put the pudina paste, mix... can add a little water. Put 6 alooos.

For aata: Put 2.5 cups maida for 8 samosas. Put 3 tbsp oil in the middle, and add namak. Mix with maida. Add paani dheere dheere and make aata. Cover with cloth for 1/2 hour. Cut into round balls then cover again for 10 mins. Make a rectangular-oval shape, cut in half, you get 2 samosas.

recipes.name: Soupy Momos
recipes.description: Frozen momos in flavorful soup broth
recipes.ingredients:
Frozen momos
Onions, chopped
Garlic, chopped
1 green chilli, chopped
Oil or butter
Vinegar
Water
Salt
Soy sauce
Black pepper
Spring onion for garnish
recipes.instructions: Buy any frozen momos (prasuma recommended) or make at home! For the soup, chop onions, garlic and one green chilli. In a pan, take some oil/butter, put the green chillis and garlic. After the garlic is golden brown, put the chopped onions, saute them, keep them crunchy. Now put a little vinegar, add water. Add salt, soy sauce and black pepper. Add the amount of water you want in your soup. Keep adjusting the taste of the condiments till you like it. Add the frozen momos, boil them for the instructed time or if you trust your judgement, till you think they are cooked, not mushy. Serve it hot. Garnish with spring onion, momos chutney etc if you have it.

recipes.name: Broccoli Soup
recipes.description: Creamy and chunky broccoli soup with garlic
recipes.ingredients:
Broccoli
2 onions
5-6 medium garlic cloves
Water
Butter
Cheese
Oregano
Chilli flakes
Black pepper
Salt
recipes.instructions: Take brocolli, 2 onions and 5-6 medium sized cloves of garlic. Boil all of this in water for 10-12 mins. Put a timer for 5 mins, after which take out a little brocolli to add as garnish for crunch later. After 10-12 mins, take out the boiled stuff, let it cool and blend it together into a paste, doesn't have to be very smooth, depends on what crunch to smooth ratio you want it. Now take the same pan you took for boiling this stuff, after removing everything from it obviously and then heat it to remove residual water droplets. Add butter, cheese, the broccoli paste you just made. Then you just wing it with the oregano, chilli flakes, black pepper and salt. Bring it to a boil. Keep adding condiments and tasting. Add the broccoli pieces for garnish too while its boiling. And then you're done.

recipes.name: Momos Chutney
recipes.description: Spicy tomato-based chutney perfect for momos
recipes.ingredients:
2 dried red chillies
2 medium tomatoes
4 garlic cloves
1 inch ginger
1 tbsp sugar
1/2 tbsp salt
1 tsp vinegar
1 tsp soy sauce
4-5 cashews or almonds
recipes.instructions: Boil these things, till tomato skin comes off. Peel tomato, let it cool. In a mixer, add tomatoes, chillis, 4 garlic cloves, 1 inch ginger, 1 tablespoon sugar, half tablespoon salt, 1 tsp vinegar, 1 tsp soya sauce, 4-5 cashews or badaam. Mix, you're done!

recipes.name: Rice Paper Paneer Veggie Pancakes
recipes.description: Crispy rice paper pancakes filled with seasoned paneer and vegetables
recipes.ingredients:
200g paneer, crumbled
1 tsp cornflour
Salt and pepper
Oil
3 tsp soy sauce
2 tsp vinegar
1-2 tbsp Schezwan sauce
1 tbsp ketchup
1/2 medium onion, sliced
4 garlic cloves, chopped
2 tsp brown/white sugar
Mixed vegetables (carrot, bell pepper, cabbage)
Rice paper sheets
Green onions and sesame seeds for garnish
recipes.instructions: Combine crumbled paneer (200 gm) with cornflour-1 spoon, salt & pepper. Take some oil in a pan, put the paneer mixture, cook till the paneer turns a nice brown (very light, don't burn it). Then add soy sauce-3 tsps, vinegar-2tsps, Schezwan sauce- 1-2 tbsps, ketchup-1 tbsp, sliced green onion (the white part) or normal onion-about half of a medium sized onion, chopped garlic-4 cloves, grated ginger-or ginger paste - I didn't put but can try next time & brown or white sugar-2 tsps. Cook it until well-mixed and seasoned to taste. Then take it off heat and add your vegetables (carrot, bell pepper, cabbage) to the pan, add a bit of salt. Brush a non-stick pan with oil, soak rice paper sheets in water, place one sheet in the pan, add the paneer mixture, cover with another rice paper sheet, and fry until crispy on both sides. Sprinkle with chopped green onions and sesame seeds for garnish- optional. For the dipping sauce, mix soy sauce, sesame oil, rice wine vinegar, brown sugar, ginger juice, chopped green onion, and sesame seeds - I just took soy sauce. Serve the Paneer Veggie Rice Paper Pancakes with the flavourful dipping sauce.

recipes.name: Egg Fried Rice
recipes.description: Simple and flavorful fried rice with scrambled eggs
recipes.ingredients:
Cooked rice
Oil
Cumin/mustard seeds
4-5 garlic cloves, chopped
1 green chilli (optional)
1 medium onion, chopped
1 capsicum, diced
Turmeric (pinch)
Salt
Eggs
Butter
recipes.instructions:
Add oil in a pan. Put some jeera/mustard seeds and let them pop. Then add chopped garlic (4-5) and one mirchi if you want and let the garlic turn golden brown. Add a medium sized chopped onion, cook it till the crunch you like. Add a square cut pieces of capsicum for a little more crunch and colour. Add a pinch of haldi, salt and put in the rice. You can keep adding salt after you've put the rice according to your preference (add more salt here if you don't put salt in your scrambled eggs).

For the scrambled eggs: Make scrambled eggs like usual (add butter in oil to make it more rich). Don't cook them till extremely dry. Put them in with the fried rice. Mix mix mix. Eat!

recipes.name: Tomato Soup
recipes.description: Classic creamy tomato soup with herbs
recipes.ingredients:
4-5 tomatoes
1 inch ginger
2 onions, roughly chopped
7-8 small garlic cloves
Butter
Oregano
Ketchup
Sugar
Black pepper
Chilli flakes
Pizza pasta sauce
Salt
recipes.instructions: Take 4-5 tomatoes, boil then along with an inch of ginger. Take them out, peel the tomato skins. Take 2 Onions and 7-8 small garlics, roughly chop. Roast in a pan with butter. Add the peeled and roughly chopped tomatoes too along with the ginger. Blend in a mixer, drain using large seive. In a pan take butter, add drained mixture. Add seasoning (oregano, ketchup, sugar, black pepper, chilli flakes, pizza pasta sauce salt). Serve with garlic bread.

recipes.name: Avocado Toast with Pickled Onions
recipes.description: Healthy avocado toast topped with roasted tomatoes and pickled onions
recipes.ingredients:
1 ripe avocado
1-2 garlic cloves, minced
1/2 tsp oregano
Juice of half lemon
Fresh parsley/coriander
Cherry tomatoes, halved
1 onion, very thinly sliced
Water
Vinegar (equal to water)
3-4 tbsp sugar
Salt
2 bread slices
recipes.instructions: Make sure the avocado is ripe, rinse under cold water, pat dry, cut in half vertically, going around the pit. Twist the 2 halves apart, remove seed, scoop the avocado with spoon, mash with fork. Add 1-2 cloves finely minced garlic + 1/2 tsp oregano + juice of half a lemon (to maintain color) + herbs like parsley/coriander. Mix well. For the dressing, roast some chopped garlic and cherry tomatoes cut into half with a little salt and some oregano. Make some pickled onions - cut veryyyy thin slices of onions and put this in a glass jar. Take water and equal or thoda less part vinegar + 3-4 spoon sugar + thoda salt, heat on medium flame for 1-2 mins till the sugar dissolves. Keep the mixture to cool, then pour over the onions and cool to room temp. Put in the fridge with the lid on the jar. Will be pickled in about an hour if the onions are thinly sliced. This can be stored in the fridge for upto 1 week. Now toast 2 bread slices. Smear the avocado paste on them, put the tomatoes and the onions. You can add extra salt/oregano if you like. Enjoy!

recipes.name: Beetroot Raita
recipes.description: Colorful and nutritious raita with beetroot and spices
recipes.ingredients:
1 beetroot
1/2 cucumber (optional)
Ghee
Cumin seeds
Mustard seeds
7-8 curry leaves
1 green chilli (optional)
Salt
Roasted cumin powder (optional)
Coriander powder (optional)
Curd (1/4 cup or more)
Chaat masala (optional)
recipes.instructions: Take one beetroot, wash it, peel it, wash it again. Grate it with a fine grater. (Optional) Add half a cucumber - grated in the beetroot. Now prepare the tadka. In a small pan, take ghee, put jeera and mustard seeds, then 7-8 kadhi patta (or however many you like) and green chilli (skip if you don't want it to be spicy). After everything has popped, put the beetroot and cucumber mixture in the pan, mix it and roast for a bit, add salt and if you like a little bit of roasted jeera powder or dhaniya masala. Turn off the gas, let it cool. In a bowl, take curd, make it lump free if not already, put the mixture in it, mix. Enjoy! You can also add salt, chaat masala etc after this is done according to your taste and preference.

recipes.name: Cucumber Curd Salad
recipes.description: Refreshing salad with cucumbers in seasoned yogurt
recipes.ingredients:
2 cucumbers, sliced round
1/4 cup curd, whisked smooth
Salt
Powdered sugar
1 onion, chopped
4-5 garlic cloves, finely chopped
Fresh coriander, chopped (optional)
Soy sauce to taste
recipes.instructions: Take 2 cucumbers, slice them aese round, keep dahi aese smooth whisked about 1/4th cup, usme kheere daal do. Then add salt, powdered sugar, 1 chopped onion (or more if you like), 4-5 finely chopped garlic, you can add chopped coriander too. Put kikkoman soy sauce according to taste hehe. Then mix and adjust taste as per you.

recipes.name: Curd Rice
recipes.description: South Indian comfort food with tempered yogurt rice
recipes.ingredients:
Cooked rice
Curd/yogurt
Salt
Cumin powder
Ghee
Mustard seeds
Hing (asafoetida)
1 tsp chana dal
1 tsp urad dal
Green chilli (optional)
Curry leaves
Ginger paste or grated ginger
Fresh coriander, chopped
Pomegranate (optional)
recipes.instructions: Bane hue chawal lo, unko thoda smash karo, halka halka, not very zyada, fir usme dahi add karo to the consistency jo aapko chahiye for your curd rice, then add namak and halka sa jeera powder if you have, taste karke adjust karlo namak. Then in the chotu vala tadka pan, take thoda ghee, put mustard seeds, thooooda sa hing and one tsp chana and one tsp urad daal for crunch, saute for a minute then add green chilli (I skipped this) and kadhi patte, and thoda ginger paste or grated ginger if you have it. Then pour this over your dahi chawal and mix. Lastly garnish with finely chopped coriander and pomegranate (optional).

recipes.name: Bhel Puri
recipes.description: Popular Mumbai street food snack
recipes.ingredients:
Ready-to-eat bhel packet
Onions, finely chopped
Tomatoes, finely chopped
Grapes
Pomegranate
Lemon juice
Green chutney
Tamarind chutney
recipes.instructions: Take the ready to eat bhel vala packet - preferably the one which comes with the container. Add finely chopped onions + tomato + grapes + pomegranate + nimbu + thodi green chutney if available + uske sath jo imli types chutney aati hai. Basically it should be a combination of sweet sour savoury, crunchy, everything.

recipes.name: Aglio Olio Spaghetti
recipes.description: Classic Italian pasta with garlic, olive oil, and chilli flakes
recipes.ingredients:
Spaghetti
Salt
Olive oil (about 20-25ml)
8-9 garlic cloves, sliced
Chilli flakes
Oregano
Fresh parsley, finely chopped
recipes.instructions:
Boil spaghetti with some salt, don't overcook it but don't leave it kaccha also. Boil it till you feel like you could eat in this consistency, but it would be okay if it was thoda or cooked also - drain and save the pasta water!!!!!!

Now in a pan, take olive oil, a good quantity, 100 ml choti bottle hai toh take 1/5th or 1/4th of that bottle. Then take 8-9 cloves of garlic, slice them and put them in it when the oil is not that hot - to let the garlic infuse with the oil. Add chilli flakes to this and toss till the garlic is slightly golden, shouldn't be burnt. Then add half cup pasta water and salt. Mix it and add your cooked spaghetti. Add some oregano, mix it well, the spaghetti will cook some more in this water, if you feel like or paani chahiye toh you can keep adding more in small batches. Add finely chopped parsely, mix evrything well and done!
